text:
Hello
i know that there were issues about this topic (https://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=40189, https://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=51798 ), but they didnt help me...

problem is that after running testplan successfully i see something like this:
DEBUG   2013-10-22 11:13:01.001 [jmeter.J] (): JMeter.init
DEBUG   2013-10-22 11:13:01.100 [com.comp] (): Register Jmeter shut down hook
Created the tree successfully using <path_to_testplan>
Starting the test @ Tue Oct 22 11:13:01 CEST 2013 (1382433181985)
Waiting for possible shutdown message on port 4445
Tidying up ...    @ Tue Oct 22 11:13:07 CEST 2013 (1382433187296)
... end of run

and after that it hangs.
please note, that this testplan uses a plugin that i'm trying to write on my own. Maybe you could help my analyse attached thread dump to find out what is wrong?

best regards,
R
creator: radoslaw.domanski@computaris.com

text:
Bugzilla is not a support forum.
Please ask your question on JMeter User Mailing list you will certainly get help there.

Thank you
creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
sebb@apache.org
text:
There are several non-daemon threads that are in WAITING state. At least one of these is using 3rd party code:

gov.nist.javax.sip.EventScanner.run(EventScanner.java:493)

It looks like the plugin - or something it uses - is creating threads that stop the application from exitting.

This is not a JMeter bug and is off-topic for Bugzilla.

creator: radoslaw.domanski@computaris.com
text:
ty for responses
have a nice day, sorry for off-topicing Bugzilla.

regards
